meanings.definition: To give someone the courage or confidence to do something.
meanings.sent1: The encouraging words from his friend emboldened him to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk emboldened the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent3: The playful teasing from his siblings emboldened him to try a new dance move.
meanings.sent4: The success of the small business emboldened other entrepreneurs to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The hero's bravery in the story emboldened the young readers to face their fears.

meanings.definition: To make something more noticeable or prominent.
meanings.sent1: The bright colors on the poster emboldened the message for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The bold font emboldened the title on the book cover.
meanings.sent3: The large sign emboldened the entrance to the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: The striking design emboldened the brand's identity in the market.
meanings.sent5: The dramatic lighting emboldened the stage for the performance.
